intro: Aspalathus barbigera, commonly known as the yellow bushveld pea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats, contributing to local biodiversity. Aspalathus barbigera is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
